translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Upāli
The Elder Cunda’s Birth Story🔽“I made an offering of incense
to the Fortunate One Siddhattha,
the chief in the world, the one with such and such a name;
I covered it with jasmine flowers.
Having completed that flower offering,
I presented it to the Buddha;
Having scattered the remaining flowers,
I offered them to the Buddha.
The Buddha, who was golden-coloured like an incense offering,🔽the Buddha, the chief leader in the world,
with a confident mind and a happy mind,
I presented the incense offering.
The Buddha, who had crossed over doubt,
was honoured by those who had crossed over the flood;
while sitting in the Community of monks,
he spoke these verses:
‘He who gave me this incense offering,
which is fragrant like the gods;
I will proclaim him,
listen to me as I speak.
From here this person,
honoured by the assembly of gods,
surrounded by jasmine flowers,
will go to the world of the gods.
His abode will be resplendent,
made of gold and jewels;
it will appear to him,
developed by the power of his merit.

analyzed: catusattati khattum saḥ  deva rajjam karissati
translated: For seventy-four times he will rule as king of the gods,
and will experience the glory
of being honoured by the Sakkas.

analyzed: pathabyāḥ rajjam tisata  vasudham āvasissati  pañca sattati khattum ca
translated: For three hundred years he will rule as king over the earth,🔽and will live on the earth for five hundred years.
For seventy-five times he will be a wheel-turning king.
His name will be Dujjaya,
and he will be a lord of men.
Having experienced that merit,
he will not see his own kamma.
Without going to the lower world,
he will go to the human state.
His accumulated gold will be
not less than a hundred thousand koṭis.
He will be reborn in a womb,
and will be a brahmin.
The son of Vaṅganta, the wise one,
dear to the heart of Sāri,
and later, having gone forth,
in the dispensation of Aṅgīrasa,
his name will be Cūḷacunda,
and he will be a disciple of the Teacher.
He will be a novice monk,
and will be one who has destroyed the pollutants.
Having fully understood all the pollutants,
he will be extinguished, without pollutants.’
I attended on the Great Hero,
and on many other good people.
I attended on my brother,
for the attainment of the highest goal.
Having attended to my brother,
and having placed the relic in a bowl,
I presented it to the Sambuddha,
the world’s chief, the bull of a man.
With both hands raised up,
the Buddha in the world with the gods,
and praising that relic,
praised the chief disciple.
My mind is well-liberated,
and my faith is established.
Having fully understood all the pollutants,
I live without pollutants.
I have attained the analytical knowledges,
and have experienced the liberations.
I have realized the six super-knowledges,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus has it been told by the Elder Cunda.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā cundo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Cundattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā cundaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  cundattherassa apadānam dasama
translated: The Story of the Elder Cunda is the tenth.
The fifth sub-chapter called “The Chapter of Upāli” is finished.
The summary:
Upāli, Soṇa, Bhaddiya,
Sanniṭṭhāpaka, Hatthiya,
Chadana, Seyya, Caṅkamanī,
Subhadda, and the Elder Cunda;
One hundred and thirty-six verses,
and four more besides.
